name: Student Accommodation Out of Term
short_description: Property let to students, required for educational use

notice_requirement.timing: Before or at start of tenancy
notice_requirement.content: Notice must state possession may be recovered under Ground 4
notice_requirement.exception: Court may dispense if just and equitable

prior_use.use: Occupied by students at educational institution

notice_period.court_proceedings: Can be started after notice expires

evidence_required: Written notice given at tenancy start
Evidence of prior student use (previous tenancy agreements with students, university accommodation records)
Proof property used for students within 12 months before current tenancy
Evidence of future student need (university accommodation agreements, advance bookings)

high_probability: Clear written notice at tenancy start
Strong evidence of prior student use
medium_probability: Some evidence of student use but limited
Intention to resume student letting is genuine but no firm agreements
low_probability: No notice given and court refuses to dispense
Cannot prove student use within prior 12 months
No genuine need for student accommodation
Property not suitable for student letting

red_flags: No written notice given at start
No evidence of prior student occupation
Landlord has no university accommodation agreements
No HMO license (if property requires one)
Claim appears to be pretext for eviction

typical_timeline.seasonal_note: Usually timed to regain possession before September term starts

tenant_defenses: No notice given and no good reason to dispense
Property not used for students in prior 12 months
No genuine need for student accommodation
HMO licensing issues (could delay but not prevent)
notes: Ground 4 is MANDATORY but rarely used. Most common near universities. Landlords must prove genuine student letting history and future need.
case_law: University of Reading v Johnson-Houghton [1985] - Student use must be established
Cove v Flick [2001] - Future need for student accommodation must be genuine
